question_sentence: Catholic nuns in which US state have banned their bishop from their monastery for their “spiritual safety”?
evidence: The Discalced Carmelite Nuns of Arlington said they “no longer recognise the authority” of Bishop Michael Olson, who they accuse of aggression and spiritual manipulation. The long-running row began when he accused their Mother Prioress of violating her vow of chastity by “sexting” a priest.

question_sentence: In which event did Britain’s Katarina Johnson-Thompson win gold at the 2023 World Athletics Championship?
evidence: Johnson-Thompson clinched her second World Championship title by running a personal best in the final 800-metre event on Sunday in Budapest. The victory marks a remarkable comeback for the 30-year-old, who suffered serious achilles tendon and calf injuries after winning gold in 2019.

question_sentence: The former prime minister of which Southeast Asian country was arrested after returning from 15 years in exile?
evidence: Former PM Thaksin Shinawatra was immediately detained and taken to court after landing in Bangkok on Tuesday. The telecoms tycoon-turned-populist politician, who fled corruption charges in 2006, was jailed for eight years.

question_sentence: A row erupted over Bradley Cooper’s prosthetic nose in an upcoming biopic about which Jewish composer?
evidence: The teaser trailer for “Maestro”, about the legendary creator of “West Side Story”, shows star Cooper wearing a prominent prosthetic nose. The actor, who also directed and co-produced the Netflix biopic, was accused of “Jewface” – when a non-Jewish actor plays a Jewish person and exaggerates so-called “Jewish” characteristics.

question_sentence: The leaders of the Brics economic bloc met for a summit this week in which city?
evidence: The three-day summit was billed as the most important in a decade for the Brics bloc, comprising Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. Tensions have been mounting among the group, which together make up 40% of the world’s population, as China pushes for an expanded bloc to challenge the G7.

question_sentence: The English federation of which sport will defy new international restrictions on transgender competitors?
evidence: The English Chess Federation (ECF) has pledged not to enforce new rules introduced by the International Chess Federation (Fide) banning transgender players from women’s tournaments. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: New research shows that global household wealth dropped by how much last year?
evidence: The drop in global household wealth was the first since the 2008 financial crisis and heralds a “richcession”, according to commentators. The new research, by financial services firm UBS, also shows that the number of millionaires fell by 3.5 million year-on-year, to 59.4 million.

question_sentence: Medical experts have criticised a new TikTok trend showing parents doing what with eggs?
choices: Daring teenagers to swallow them whole
evidence: The videos, many of which use the hashtag #eggprank, are getting millions of views, but many of the children look “upset and stunned”, said Sky News. Medical experts have also warned of the risk of salmonella.

question_sentence: More than half of US adults claim to have been visited by what in a dream, according to a new survey?
evidence: In a Pew Research Center survey of more than 5,000 people, 53% reported being visited by a deceased family member in a dream or some other form. For more stories from the stranger side of life, get The Week’s Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Where did the UK’s first womb transplant take place?
evidence: Surgeons spent eight hours removing the womb of a 40-year-old donor, followed by a further nine hours implanting it into her 34-year-old sister. The transplant, at the Oxford Transplant Centre, has been hailed as the “dawn of a new era” in fertility treatment.

question_sentence: Which country successfully landed a spacecraft on the moon this week?
evidence: India on Wednesday landed its Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft on the moon, becoming only the fourth nation ever to accomplish such a feat.

question_sentence: Eight Republican presidential candidates faced off Wednesday in the first primary debate of the 2024 campaign. Where did the debate take place?
evidence: The debate took place in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The city will also be the site of the 2024 Republican National Convention, where the party will select its next presidential nominee.

question_sentence: Which political figure visited Maui this week to witness up close the devastation left by the wildfires?
evidence: President Biden visited fire-ravaged Maui as search efforts continue. He sought to reassure residents that the federal government will support their long-term recovery efforts while respecting local traditions.

question_sentence: Which airline will begin weighing some passengers before flights?
evidence: Passengers flying with Korean Air in the next few weeks may be asked to take one additional step before boarding — stepping on the scale. The purpose of the airline’s policy is to obtain data about the aircraft’s fuel needs and weight distribution.

question_sentence: Which team won the Women’s World Cup?
evidence: Spain made history by beating England 1-0 to win the Women’s World Cup for the first time.

question_sentence: Crews are cleaning up debris in the aftermath of Hurricane Hilary. Which state was badly damaged by the storm?
evidence: Hilary unleashed torrential rainfall and strong winds across portions of the southwestern US and Mexico. However, California was especially impacted by damaging floods and mudslides as the storm shuttered schools and closed businesses in the region.

question_sentence: The FDA this week approved a new vaccine for which virus?
evidence: The FDA on Monday approved the first vaccine that protects newborns from respiratory syncytial virus, known as RSV.

question_sentence: Which country is banning all seafood from Japan?
evidence: China is banning all seafood from Japan in response to Tokyo’s decision to begin releasing treated radioactive water from the Fukushima nuclear plant.

question_sentence: Which popular cooking ingredient is in trouble as extreme heat and drought push the industry into crisis?
evidence: Olive oil industry experts are warning of skyrocketing prices and potential shortages due to scorching temperatures threatening a bad olive harvest.

question_sentence: Which signature drink did Starbucks reintroduce to its menu this week?
evidence: Starbucks’ beloved Pumpkin Spice Latte is back. The signature drink returned to the fall menu on Thursday, marking its 20th anniversary.

question_sentence: What inspired Thomas Jackson to start his clothing line, "Carry My Own Weight"?
choices: A challenge to prove his friends wrong.
A childhood dream of owning a business.

question_sentence: What material is the Delrin acetal homopolymer product line, recently sold by DuPont, commonly used for?
What was the location of the unauthorized car meet where a shooting occurred?
What is the age limit for individuals to participate in virtual auditions for the upcoming season of "American Idol"?
Which football team showed significant improvement since moving to the Class 1A, potentially positioning them to contend for a state title?
According to the study conducted by Med.ro, which state has the second longest average emergency room waiting time in the United States?
Which invasive host tree appears to be the preferred choice for spotted lanternflies to lay their egg masses on?
What is the reason behind the delayed scheduling of a hearing for Pure Flavor Hookah Lounge's application for a taproom license?
choices: The lounge's owners voluntarily requested a delay in the hearing.
The Riverfront Development Corp. and local businesses were not supportive of the lounge's license application.
The state's Office of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner did not have the necessary resources.
The exact reason for the delay is unclear, as the office did not provide any explanation.

question_sentence: What is one of the reasons cited by Delmarva Power for requesting the rate increase?
choices: Recent high inflation and increased repair costs caused by severe weather events.
To provide a bonus to employees for their hard work.

question_sentence: What has contributed to the high number of vacant positions in the Division of Family Services?
choices: A lack of interest in child protection roles among professionals.
An increase in the number of cases handled by each investigator.
The decrease in the number of child abuse and neglect cases reported.
Difficulties with recruitment and retention, exacerbated by the pandemic.
